intro: Chamaesyce viscoides, commonly known as the sticky weed, is a flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States and thrives in moist, disturbed soils. The plant is characterized by its small, green, fleshy leaves and produces clusters of yellowish-green flowers. It has a creeping growth habit and can form dense mats, often spreading through stolons. The plant is often considered a weed due to its rapid growth and ability to colonize various habitats.
